title: The Sea’s Best Kept Secret: The Use of Seaweed as a Source of Biohydrogen for Clean and Renewable Energy
content:
RSC Sustain., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D3SU00381G, Tutorial Review

Olivia Wyper, Sohrab Zendehboudi, Francesca M. Kerton
Sustainable alternatives to fossil fuels and chemicals are needed. The longer we continue to use petroleum-derived materials, the greater the detrimental effects of climate change. Algae are important renewable feedstocks...
